page.title: 14Sports Hooligans, Cotteridge
page.content: We interviewed local people to discover their views about{football hooliganism} Mr Edmunds thinks more active steps should be taken {to detect the trouble makers} and Mr Middleton suggested that hooligans should have {twenty strokes} of the {cane.} Mr Purcell said that following violent incidents the {club} should be {closed for three months} and Mr Johnson would like to see the return of {public flogging.} Mrs Pagett thinks that hooligans should be made to {repair the damage} they caused and they should {visit hospitals}to see the injured. In extreme cases they should have {the birch} and be {banned} from other matches. Mrs Rowe would not like to see the erection of{electric fences} because they could endanger innocent people and Mrs Revell thinks {identity cards} should be introduced.
